thread.title: Police in Delaware fatally shoot black man in a wheelchair
thread.title_full: Police in Delaware fatally shoot black man in a wheelchair - Telegraph

author: AP
title: Police in Delaware fatally shoot black man in a wheelchair
text: Police are investigating the shooting death of a black man in a wheelchair at the hand of Wilmington police in Delaware . Officers were called to the scene after a report of a man in a wheelchair with a self-inflicted gunshot wound, Sgt Andrea Janvier said to local news. According to Wilmington police the man was found armed with a handgun upon arrival, but Sgt Janvier said the circumstances of the shooting are under investigation. The Delaware department of justice's office of civil rights and public trust is investigating and will determine whether the officers acted within the law. The agency investigates all police shootings that result in injury or death. The man, who was found dead at the scene, has been identified as 28-year-old by Robert Bovell, who has said to know family. Eugene Smith, Mr McDowell's uncle, was with Mr Bovell among a small crowd who gathered at the scene of the shooting on Thursday. "It was an execution. That's what it was. I don't care if he was black, white, whatever," said Mr Smith. The ethnicity of the officers involved was not immediately released. Police Chief Bobby Cummings and Mayor Dennis Williams have announced a news conference on Thursday afternoon to talk about the events. telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraphnews
